QuestionStatement: Which of the following policies would most likely be recommended in an economy with an annual inflation rate of 3 percent and an unemployment rate of 11 percent?
AnswerChoices: An increase in transfer payments and an increase in the reserve requirements
An increase in defense spending and an increase in the discount rate
An increase in income tax rates and a decrease in the reserve requirement
A decrease in government spending and the open market sale of government securities
A decrease in the tax rate on corporate profits and a decrease in the discount rate

QuestionStatement: The cost of reducing unemployment is accepting a higher rate of inflationThe statement above would most likely be made by a person who believes in the
AnswerChoices: Quantity theory of money
Phillips curve
Theory of rational expectations
Paradox of value
Liquidity trap

QuestionStatement: Which of the following would occur if the international value of the United States dollar decreased?
AnswerChoices: United States exports would rise
More gold would flow into the United States
United States demand for foreign currencies would increase
The United States trade deficit would increase
Americans would pay less for foreign good

QuestionStatement: Which of the following will occur as a result of an improvement in technology?
AnswerChoices: The aggregate demand curve will shift to the right
The aggregate demand curve will shift to the left
The aggregate supply curve will shift to the right
The aggregate supply curve will shift to the left
The production possibilities curve will shift inward

QuestionStatement: Assume that land in an agricultural economy can be used either for producing grain or for grazing cattle to produce beef.  The opportunity cost of converting an acre from cattle grazing to grain production is the
AnswerChoices: Market value of the extra grain that is produced
Total amount of beef produced
Number of extra bushels of grain that are produced
Amount by which beef production decreases
Profits generated by the extra production of grain

QuestionStatement: Which of the following workers is most likely to be classified as structurally unemployed?
AnswerChoices: A high school teacher who is unemployed during the summer months
A recent college graduate who is looking for her first job
A teenager who is seeking part-time employment at a fast food restaurant
A worker who is unemployed because his skills are obsolete
A woman who reenters the job market after her child begins elementary school

QuestionStatement: According to the classical model, an increase in the money supply causes an increase in which of the following?I.      The price levelII.      Nominal gross national productIII.      Nominal wages
AnswerChoices: I only
II only
III only
II and III only
I, II, and III

QuestionStatement: If, in response to an increase in investment of $10 billion, equilibrium income rises by a total of $50 billion, then marginal propensity to save is
In the circular flow diagram, which of the following is true?
AnswerChoices: Businesses pay wages, rent, interest, and profits to households in return for use of factors of production
Businesses purchase goods and services from households in return for money payments
Households pay wages, rent, interest, and profits to businesses in return for use of factors of production
The relationship between households and businesses exists only in traditional society
The relationship between households and businesses exists only in a command economy

QuestionStatement: Assume that the reserve requirement is 25 percent.  If banks have excess reserves of $10000, which of the following is the maximum amount of additional money that can be created by the banking system through the lending process?
According to the Keynesian model, an increase in the money supply affects output more if
AnswerChoices: Investment is sensitive to interest rates
Money demand is sensitive to interest rates
The unemployment rate is low
Consumption is sensitive to the Phillips curve
Government spending is sensitive to public opinion

QuestionStatement: Which of the following combinations of monetary and fiscal policies is coordinated to increase output?
AnswerChoices: See above
See above
See above
See above
See above

QuestionStatement: Which of the following is a possible cause of stagflation (simultaneous high unemployment and high inflation)?
AnswerChoices: Increase in labor productivity
Increase in price for raw materials
The rapid growth and development of the computer industry
A decline in labor union membership
A low growth rate of the money supply

QuestionStatement: If exchange rates are allowed to fluctuate freely and the United States demand for German marks increases, which of the following will most likely occur?
AnswerChoices: Americans will have to pay more for goods made in Germany
Germans will find that American goods are getting more expensive
The United States balance-of-payments deficit will increase
The dollar price of marks will fall
The dollar price of German goods will fall

QuestionStatement: Which of the following would most likely be the immediate result if the United States increased tariffs on most foreign goods?
AnswerChoices: The United States standard of living would be higher
More foreign goods would increase
Prices of domestic goods would increase
Large numbers of United States workers would be laid off
The value of the United States dollar would decrease against foreign currencies

QuestionStatement: Which of the following must be true of a country that is operating inside its production possibilities frontier?
AnswerChoices: It has a market economy
It has a command economy
It is in the early stages of industrial development
It is using resources inefficiently
It has plentiful resources

QuestionStatement: Which of the following is an example of ÒinvestmentÓ as the term is used by economists?
AnswerChoices: A schoolteacher purchases 10,000 shares of stock in an automobile company
Newlyweds purchase a previously owned home
One large automobile firm purchases another large automobile firm
A farmer purchases $10,000 worth of government securities
An apparel company purchases 15 new sewing machines

QuestionStatement: If the gross national product increased from $930 billion in 1969 to $975 billion in 1970 solely because of a rise in the price level, which of the following was necessarily true?
AnswerChoices: Real gross national product increased between 1969 and 1970
Real gross national product decreased between 1969 and 1970
Nominal income increased between 1969 and 1970
Real income increased between 1969 and 1970
The rise in the price level between 1969 and 1970 was greater than 10 percent

QuestionStatement: The diagram above shows two aggregate supply curves, AS1 and AS2.  Which of the following statements most accurately characterizes the AS1 curve relative to the AS2 curve?
AnswerChoices: AS1 is Keynesian because it reflects greater wage and price flexibility
AS1 is classical because it reflects greater wage and price flexibility
AS1 is Keynesian because it reflects less wage and price flexibility
AS1 is classical because it reflects less wage and price flexibility
AS1 could be either classical or Keynesian because it reflects greater wage flexibility but less price flexibility

QuestionStatement: If the marginal propensity to consume is 0.9, what is the maximum amount that the equilibrium gross national product could change if government expenditures increase by $1 billion?
AnswerChoices: It could decrease by up to $9 billion
It could increase by up to $0.9 billion
It could increase by up to $1 billion
It could increase by up to $9 billion
It could increase by up to $10 billion
